sentence.text: In 1913 Studd and his daughter Edith 's young fianc√© Alfred Buxton , a descendant of the emancipator Sir Thomas Fowell Buxton [ q.v. ] , bicycled across East Africa to a populous region untouched by Christianity .
When he was a director of Sotheby 's he would bicycle into work each day .
When he had leisure he went bicycling to Lincolnshire village churches .
He waved , and bicycled off again .

Laura grinned as she recalled her early teens when she and Liz , together with their school-friend Julie , had spent the holidays climbing trees , swimming , and bicycling around the beautiful Devonshire countryside .

For two summer holidays my parents took a Prep school outside Westerham and from here we bicycled over half of Kent with our Father or played on the small school fields or swam in the local swimming bath .
` Well , I bicycled round Siena with a gun in the basket on my handlebars , underneath my exercise books and Petrarch 's sonnets .
I then bicycled down to the Schools -- sat down in my place .
They were soon joined by Duncan Curr , member of Dublin Street Baptist Church and Chairman of Christian Aid/CEEC , who had bicycled in from Juniper Green - and eventually , ny me .
Ramsey bicycled over to Wordsworth Grove to see if there were any letters .
The postman usually bicycled up around mid-morning , a time when everyone in the house was busy or pretending to be .
When he married he rented a rambling red-brick Georgian house two miles away and bicycled to work at the forge most days .
